div1.p: Freeman praises the accomplishments of Henry Rose Carter, Walter Reed, and William Crawford Gorgas.

div1.head: Excerpt from editorial, by Douglas Freeman, November 10, 1914
div1.p:
(From editorial by Douglas Freeman in Richmond News Leader, Nov. 10, 1914,
on the occasion of the meeting of the Southern Medical at Richmond.)

***“Henry R. Carter, whose early work made possible the experiments
of Walter Reed and the remarkable sanitary conquests of Gorgas.

The very mention of Reed completes the triumvirate. For while young
Gorgas was leading his cow up Fifth Street and young Carter in Hanover Coun-
ty was wondering at war, the Gloucester County preacher's boy was 14 years
old, all unconscious of his future fame, and scarcely thinking of medi-
cine as a career.

We doubt if modern science records a like example of men of kin-
dred sympathy and almost common birth whose labors in the same field of
endeavor yeieled such notable results. Carter and Reed were native Vir-
ginians, Gorgas, as the son of General Josiah Gorgas, passed the forma-
tive years of his life in this State and is knit to us by ties so close
that we always think of him as a Virginian. They never knew one another
until manhood, but then they cooperated with splendid comradeship in the
study of yellow fever--that baffling scourge of the tropics. Dr. Carter
worked out the extrinsic period of incubation, Dr. Reed at Columbia Bar-
racks, Quemados, proved the responsibility of the Stegomyia fasciata for
the carriage of yellow fever; Dr. Gorgas, first at Havana and then at
Panama, worked out measures for the prevention of the disease, without
which, as all the world knows, the greatest engineering feat of the ages,
the completion of the Panama Canal, could not have been accomplished.

The Commonwealth that boasts great soldiers like Washington, Jack-
son and Lee, great jurists like Wythe, Marshall and Roane and great states-
men like Jefferson, Madison and Monroe rejoices that she has a claim on
three of the greatest benefactors of our day--Carter, Reed and Gorgas.”
